thread.title: State of Yucatán on alert for the passage of Hurricane Milton
thread.title_full: State of Yucatán on alert for the passage of Hurricane Milton

author: archyworldyscom
title: State of Yucatán on alert for the passage of Hurricane Milton
text:
The Mexican authorities warned this Monday that Milton, which intensified this morning into a category 5 hurricane, could hit during the night between the municipalities of Celestún and Progreso , in the state of Yucatán , in the south-east of the country, so they asked the population to take extreme precautions.
“Considering the cone of uncertainty and low pressure over Yucatán, and given its movement towards the northern coast of Campeche and Yucatán, it is expected that, during this night, the center of the hurricane may strike between Celestún and Progreso,” they said the coordinator of the National Meteorological Service (SMN), Alejandra Méndez Girón.
Having said that, indicated in a statement that a prevention zone is maintained from Celestún to Río Lagartos , Yucatán; hurricane effects surveillance zone from Río Lagartos to Cabo Catoche, Quintana Roo , as well as from Celestún to San Francisco de Campeche.
The official stressed that, after landing, its cloud bands will affect northern Campeche and Quintana Roo and the entire state of Yucatán.
After the possible impact, he said the center of the meteor is expected to move along the coast of Yucatán, north of Quintana Roo, where it could change direction towards the northeast, and by Wednesday head towards Florida, in the United States.
He pointed out that at 12:00 Central Mexican Time (18:00 GMT), Milton was 130 kilometers (km) northwest of Celestún and 170 km west-northwest of Progreso, both cities in Yucatán, with winds of 280 kilometers per hour. (km/h), gusts of 330 km/h and moving eastward at 15 km/h.
Furthermore, It was expected to hit the peninsula with winds between 180 and 200 km/h, waves 6 to 8 meters high, torrential rain in Campeche, Yucatán and Quintana Roo. entities where flooding and rising levels of rivers and streams are expected.
Furthermore, he noted, Possible waterspouts and damage to the electrical system and houses with tin roofs are expected.
Hours before, The Mexican authorities have activated emergency plans by the country’s Armed Forces in prevention mode to deal with any disasters caused by the cyclone.
In the 2024 hurricane season, three cyclones hit Mexico across the Atlantic : Hurricane Beryl and Storm Chris, which left a white trail in July, and Storm Alberto, in June, when it left six people dead in Nuevo León, northern Mexico.
The Mexican government reported last Friday at least 236,636 people affected in Guerrero, a state in southern Mexico that on September 23 was hit by John, a category 3 hurricane that caused at least 29 deaths, accumulated in the states of Guerrero, Oaxaca and Michoacán . and severe flooding that subsides very slowly.
